instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]SMC compatibility between <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello,

Simple question... is the SMC swappable between a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board and a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board?

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]SMC compatibility between <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: It will be confused at the lack of/addition of GPU temperature sensors.

threads.title: [SOLVED]SMC compatibility between <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Nope, fan issues due to missing thermal sensor from GPU.

threads.title: [SOLVED]SMC compatibility between <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
